003
004package kut;
005
006import java.util.function.Predicate;
007import java.io.InputStream;
008import java.io.OutputStream;
009import java.io.IOException;
010import java.net.ServerSocket;
011import java.net.Socket;
012
013/** TCP communications management. */
014public class Tcp {
015  Tcp () {}
016
017  /**
018   * Waits for a new connection on server 'sv'.<p>
019   * 'accept' returns an Rs with the following two elements:<ul>
020   * <li>ok: A new tcp connection to use with tcp.read, tcp.readBin, tcp.Write
021          or tcp.writeBin.
022   * <li>error: An error message.
023   * </ul>
024   * @param sv Server.
025   * @return Socket.
026   */
027  public static Rs<Socket> accept (ServerSocket sv) {
028    try {
029      return Rs.ok(sv.accept());
030    } catch (Exception e) {
031      return Rs.error(e.getMessage());
032    }
033  }
034
035  /**
036   * Client connection.
037   * @param sv Server host.
038   * @param port Connection port.
039   * @return Socket
040   */
041  public static Rs<Socket> dial (String sv, int port) {
042    try {
043      return Rs.ok(new Socket(sv, port));
044    } catch (Exception e) {
045      return Rs.error(e.getMessage());
046    }
047  }
048
049  /**
050   * Read a connection,
051   * @param conn Connection to read.
052   * @param seconds: Maximum waiting time.
053   * @param fn Function to recieve data and determine when the reading is
054   *    finished.<ul>
055   *    <li>When returns 'true' reading is stopped.
056   *    <li>When returns 'false' reading continues.
057   *  </ul>
058   */
059  public static void read (
060    Socket conn, int seconds, Predicate<Rs<byte[]>> fn
061  ) {
062    try {
063      conn.setSoTimeout(seconds * 1000);
064      InputStream is = conn.getInputStream();
065      byte[] bs = Bytes.mk(100000);
066      for (;;) {
067        int len = is.read(bs);
068        if (len == -1) {
069          fn.test(Rs.error("Unexpected end of connection"));
070          break;
071        }
072        if (fn.test(Rs.ok(Bytes.take(bs, len)))) break;
073      }
074    } catch (Exception e) {
075      fn.test(Rs.error(e.getMessage()));
076    }
077  }
078
079  /**
080   * Returns a tcp server to use with 'tcp.accept'.
081   * @param port Comunications port.
082   * @param conns Maximum sumultaneous connections.
083   * @return Tcp server.
084   */
085  public static ServerSocket server (int port, int conns) {
086    try {
087      return new ServerSocket(port, conns);
088    } catch (IOException e) {
089      throw new IllegalStateException(e);
090    }
091  }
092
093  /**
094   * Write in a connection and returns an error message or an empty string
095   * if there was some error.
096   * @param conn Connection for writting.
097   * @param bs Bytes to write.
098   * @return Error or "".
099   */
100  public static String write (Socket conn, byte[] bs) {
101    try {
102      OutputStream os = conn.getOutputStream();
103      os.write(bs);
104      return "";
105    } catch (IOException e) {
106      return e.getMessage();
107    }
108  }
109}
